```{r}
library(dplyr)

df <- read.csv("/mnt/data/student_data/student-mat.csv", sep = ";")

df <- df %>%
  transmute(
    G3,
    failures,
    has_failure = as.integer(failures > 0),   # 0/1
    pass_math   = as.integer(G3 >= 10)        # 0/1
  )

str(df)

g0 <- subset(df, has_failure == 0)$G3
g1 <- subset(df, has_failure == 1)$G3

# Descriptives
c(n0 = length(g0), mean0 = mean(g0), sd0 = sd(g0))
c(n1 = length(g1), mean1 = mean(g1), sd1 = sd(g1))

# Welch two-sample t test (default var.equal = FALSE)
t_out <- t.test(G3 ~ has_failure, data = df, conf.level = 0.95)
t_out

```
